New Records: Jamal Murray recorded 21 points, nine assists, a steal, and a block in the game.
Michael Porter Jr. scored 19 points and eight rebounds.
Russell Westbrook scored 11 of his 19 points in the third quarter and celebrated a rock-the-baby moment after an and-one against Norman Powell.
DeAndre Jordan contributed with 12 points and nine rebounds.
Key Match Events: The Nuggets had six players in double figures, showcasing a balanced attack.
Russell Westbrook's rock-the-baby celebration after a key play was a notable moment.
The Clippers' Norman Powell scored 30 points, but James Harden was held to 16 points on 15 shots.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Michael Malone emphasized the importance of not losing two in a row and highlighted the contributions of Reggie Jackson in a previous game without Nikola Jokic and Aaron Gordon.
The Nuggets were without Jokic and Gordon due to injury, but their depth and team effort were key to the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Malone reflected on the win and its significance, noting the Nuggets' 8-0 record in back-to-back games but struggles in games without Jokic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers entered the game with a 20-16 record, half a game back from fourth place in the Western Conference.
The Nuggets' win tightened their grip on a tiebreaker with the Clippers, who had previously led the season series 2-0.
